gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.TwoD
Class ArrayGenerator

java.lang.Object
  gov.anl.ipns.ViewTools.Components.TwoD.ArrayGenerator
All Implemented Interfaces:
IVirtualArray, IVirtualArray2D
public class ArrayGenerator
extends java.lang.Object
implements IVirtualArray2D

This class generates values for an array based on an equation. The data array never actually exists until asked for. This class can be used to test large arrays without actually storing all of the values.

Method Detail

getAxisInfo

public AxisInfo getAxisInfo(int axiscode)
Returns the attributes of the data array in a AxisInfo wrapper. This method will take in a boolean value to determine for which axis info is being retrieved for.

Specified by:
getAxisInfo in interface IVirtualArray
Parameters:
axiscode - The integer code for this axis.
Returns:
If AxisInfo.X_AXIS, AxisInfo object with X axis info is returned. If AxisInfo.Y_AXIS, AxisInfo object with Y axis info is returned. Else, the data axis info is returned.
See Also:
AxisInfo

getDataValue

public float getDataValue(int row,
                          int column)
Get value for a single array element. If row or column exceeds the array, Float.NaN is returned. Use a statement similar to: " Float.isNaN( data.getDataValue(row,col) ) " to check if the value returned is Float.NaN.

Specified by:
getDataValue in interface IVirtualArray2D
Parameters:
row - row number of element
column - column number of element
Returns:
If element is found, the float value for that element is returned. If element is not found, Float.NaN is returned.

                         float value)
This method is here to satisfy the interface, no setting is done since values are calculated.

Parameters:
row - row number of element
column - column number of element
value - value that element will be set to

getRowValues

public float[] getRowValues(int row,
                            int from,
                            int to)
Get values for a portion or all of a row. The "from" and "to" values must be direct array reference, i.e. because the array positions start at zero, not one, this must be accounted for. If the array passed in exceeds the bounds of the array, get values for array elements and ignore extra values.

Specified by:
getRowValues in interface IVirtualArray2D
Parameters:
row - the row number being altered
from - the column number of first element to be altered
to - the column number of the last element to be altered
Returns:
If row, from, and to are valid, an array of floats containing the specified section of the row is returned. If row, from, or to are invalid, an empty 1-D array is returned.

setRowValues

public void setRowValues(float[] values,
                         int row,
                         int start)
This method is here to satisfy the interface, no setting is done since values are calculated.

Parameters:
values - array of elements to be put into the row
row - row number of desired row
start - what column number to start at

getColumnValues

public float[] getColumnValues(int column,
                               int from,
                               int to)
Get values for a portion or all of a column. The "from" and "to" values must be direct array reference, i.e. because the array positions start at zero, not one, this must be accounted for. If the array passed in exceeds the bounds of the array, get values for array elements and ignore extra values.

Specified by:
getColumnValues in interface IVirtualArray2D
Parameters:
column - column number of desired column
from - the row number of first element to be altered
to - the row number of the last element to be altered
Returns:
If column, from, and to are valid, an array of floats containing the specified section of the row is returned. If row, from, or to are invalid, an empty 1-D array is returned.

getRegionValues

public float[][] getRegionValues(int row_start,
                                 int row_stop,
                                 int col_start,
                                 int col_stop)
Returns the values in the specified region. The vertical dimensions of the region are specified by starting at first row and ending at the last row. The horizontal dimensions are determined by the first column and last column. This method also serves as the "getAllofArray". The user may obtain all of the array by specifying getRegionValues(0,END,0,END) where END is a large integer far exceeding the bounds of the array. The getRegionValues will adjust the END value to the correct size of the array. Instead of passing a copy of the whole array, a reference to the array will be passed if all of the array is asked for.

Specified by:
getRegionValues in interface IVirtualArray2D
Parameters:
row_start - first row of the region
row_stop - last row of the region
col_start - first column of the region
col_stop - last column of the region
Returns:
If a portion of the array is specified, a 2-D array copy of this portion will be returned. If all of the array is specified, a reference to the actual array will be returned.

setRegionValues

public void setRegionValues(float[][] values,
                            int row_start,
                            int col_start)
This method is here to satisfy the interface, no setting is done since values are calculated.

Parameters:
values - 2-D array of float values
row_start - first row of the region being altered
col_start - first column of the region being altered

setErrors

public boolean setErrors(float[][] error_values)
This will do nothing, square-root errors will be used by default.

Parameters:
error_values - The array of error values corresponding to the data.
Returns:
true if data array dimensions match the error array dimensions.

getErrors

public float[][] getErrors()
Get the error values corresponding to the data. setSquareRootErrors(true) or setErrors(array) must be called to have meaningful values returned. By default, null will be returned. If square-root values are desired and the data value is negative, the square-root of the positive value will be returned. If setErrors() was called, then the error array passed in will be returned (this array will be always have the same dimensions as the data, it will be modified if the dimensions are different).

Specified by:
getErrors in interface IVirtualArray2D
Returns:
error values of the data.

setSquareRootErrors

public void setSquareRootErrors(boolean use_sqrt_errs)
Use this method to specify whether to use error values that were passed into the setErrors() method or to use the square-root of the data value.

Parameters:
use_sqrt_errs - If true, use square-root. If false, use set error values if they exist.

getErrorValue

public float getErrorValue(int row,
                           int column)
Get an error value for a given row and column. Returns Float.NaN if row or column are invalid.

Specified by:
getErrorValue in interface IVirtualArray2D
Parameters:
row - Row number.
column - Column number.
Returns:
error value for data at [row,column]. If row or column is invalid, or if setSquareRootErrors() or setErrors is not called, Float.NaN is returned.

public static void main(java.lang.String[] args)
